title: Strictly’s Shirley Ballas bounces back from sudden illness for It Takes Two
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Shirley Ballas managed to overcome her sudden illness to appear on Strictly spin-off It Takes Two, confirming she is ‘fine’.

The 59-year-old Strictly judge previously shared pictures of herself on Instagram showing her hooked up to an intravenous drip in order to recover from illness.

The drip, as explained by Katrina from Reviv, was a ‘recovery infusion that’s great if you’re feeling sick, hungover, jet-lagged or just under the weather. It’s pumped with B12, it has an anti-inflammatory medication, vitamin C, magnesium and all the stuff that’ll make Shirley feel better – especially during this awful weather.’

After the post, Shirley appeared with hosts Rylan Clark-Neal and Zoe Ball on It Takes Two, where she addressed the illness.

Shirley seems to be on the mend (Picture: Shirley Ballas/Instagram)

Speaking about her Strictly experience on this year’s series, Shirley said: ‘I’m having an absolute blast. A little bit sick today but managed to get out of bed and come here.

Asked how she feels now following the drips, Shirley added: ‘I’m fine.’

It’s been a tough week for Shirley, after facing a backlash over the judges’ decisions on Saturday and Sunday night’s Strictly Come Dancing.

The judges – Shirley, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, and Bruno Tonioli – were called out for their bizarre scoring, with some deeming them inconsistent.

It led to a shock elimination as Dianne Buswell and Dev Griffin were sent home on Sunday, after ending up in the bottom two with Viscountess Emma Weymouth.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on BBC One Saturday.
